definition[0]: the activity of producing conditions which are similar to real ones, especially in order to test something, or the conditions that are produced
example[0]: a computer simulation used to train airline pilots
example[1]: a simulation of a rainforest environment
definition[1]: an activity or situation that produces conditions which are not real, but have the appearance of being real, used especially for testing something
example[2]: A computer simulation allows project engineers to study in detail the manufacturing process operations at the factory site.
